data.title: Tim Berners-Lee:: The Creator of The World Wide WEB
data.meta_description: Presentation1 - Free download as Powerpoint Presentation (.ppt / .pptx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or view presentation slides online. Tim Berners-Lee is recognized as the inventor of the World Wide Web. He was born in 1955 in London, England and showed an early interest in computers and electronics. While working as a contractor for CERN, Berners-Lee created the fundamental technologies of the World Wide Web, including hypertext, HTTP, and HTML. His creation revolutionized how information is shared and accessed globally. He was knighted by Queen Elizabeth for his contributions to the development of the internet.
data.text: Tim Berners-Lee:: The Creator of The World Wide WEB
